attributes.action:
Reinstate the pensioners triple lock.
They cannot cope with the price rises.
attributes.additional_details: Help the pensioners to level up!
attributes.background:
Inflation is heading for 7% and pensioners cannot cope with this year's price rises.
We are the fifth largest economy and have the lowest pensions in Europe!

other_parliamentary_business.body:
On Monday 8 November, MPs debated the state pension triple lock. This was an opposition day debate on a motion chosen by the Labour Party.
Watch the debate (https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Event/Index/f7694c8f-2849-452b-adf1-5fcbf62b352d)
Read a transcript of the debate (https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2022-11-08/debates/F43447C5-83DD-4D86-863B-8C7BFED3E4B5/StatePensionTripleLock)
During the debate, MPs raised concerns about the risks to older people and pensioners of the cost of living crisis. At the end of the debate, MPs agreed a motion calling on the Government to commit to maintaining the State Pension triple lock in financial year 2023-24. This motion is not binding, so it is still up to the Government whether to maintain the state pension triple lock.
What is an Opposition Day debate?
Opposition days are days allocated for the discussion of subjects chosen by non-government parties. There are usually 20 opposition days per Parliamentary session.
Read a research briefing (https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn06315/#fullreport) by the House of Commons Library about opposition day debates.
Get involved in the work of the UK Parliament
Sign up to the Your UK Parliament newsletter (https://parliament.us16.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=3ad7e4c57a864f07e4db008c4&id=26d0645ea9) for the latest information on how to get involved and make a difference.
